segments.text: I would like to buy a ticket to New York please .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: When do you plan to travel ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I ’ d like to pack my bags and leave tonight .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Are you aware that without two weeks advance notice prices will be very high ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes I know , but I just got the chance to leave and so I am going to take it no matter what .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I understand . So that ’ s one ticket to New York , and you ’ ll be departing tonight . Will that be one-way or round trip ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I wish I could stay there , but unfortunately it will have to be a round trip ticket .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: When would you like to return ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: My return date will be the 14th .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: OK . I have several seats available . Would you like a window seat or an aisle seat ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Anything but a center seat is fine with me . The middle seat drives me crazy !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: OK Mr . Lee . I have you booked on flight 513 leaving on the 5th at 11:00 pm and arriving in New York on the 6th at 6
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Perfect ! I ’ m afraid to ask , but how much is it ?
segments.speaker: S1
